info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 03 at 3:51AM CST until March 03 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE CENTRAL OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE CENTRAL OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM CST this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * Affected Area...In the Oklahoma Panhandle...Texas County. * 20 Foot Winds...Today, south southwest at 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 25 mph. Friday, southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...Today, as low as 6 percent. Friday, as low as 13 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Today, 4. Friday, 3 to 4. * Timing...Today, 1 PM to 7 PM CST. Friday, 12 PM to 7 PM CST.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
